pgTitle: List of Knight's Cross of the Iron Cross recipients (M)

rows.text: Commander of the I./Kuban-Kosaken-Regiment 4{{refn|According to Scherzer as commander of the I./Kuban-Kosaken-Reiter-Regiment 4.|group="Note"}}

{{sortname|Robert|Macher}}?{{refn|[[Robert Macher]] received confirmation of the Knight's Cross of the Iron Cross presentation via radio transmission from the [[Flensburg Government|Dönitz Government]] to ''[[Army East Prussia (Wehrmacht)|Armeeoberkommando Ostpreußen]]'' (AOK Ostpreußen—Army High Command East Prussia) on 14 May 1945 according to [[Walther-Peer Fellgiebel]]. The AOK was still reachable until 12:00 noon on this day. This presentation is considered a direct presentation. There is no record of this presentation in the ''[[Heerespersonalamt]]'' (HPA —Army Staff Office). This presentation is void since it was made after 8 May 1945.|group="Note"}}
Chief of staff of AOK Ostpreußen
Pilot in the 7./Jagdgeschwader 2 "Richthofen"{{refn|According to Scherzer as pilot in the I./[[Jagdgeschwader 2]] "Richthofen".|group="Note"}}
Chief of the Pionier-Kompanie/Jäger-Regiment 28{{refn|According to Scherzer as chief of the 17.(Pionier)/Jäger-Regiment 28.|group="Note"}}
Commanding general of the III. Armeekorps (motorized)
Pilot and observer in the 5.(H)/Aufklärungs-Gruppe 11{{refn|According to Scherzer as pilot and observer in [[Aufklärungsgruppe 11|Aufklärungs-Gruppe 11]].|group="Note"}}
Commander of Panzergrenadier-Regiment 125{{refn|According to Scherzer as commander of Panzergrenadier-Regiment 140.|group="Note"}}
Observer in the 4.(F)/Aufklärungs-Gruppe 122{{refn|According to Scherzer as observer in the Aufklärungsstaffe 4.(F)/122.|group="Note"}}

Battery chief of the battery "Völtzendorf" in the Marine Flak-Abteilung 219 (9. Marine-Flak-Regiment){{refn|According to Scherzer as chief of battery "Völtzendorf"/Marine Flak-Abteilung 219.|group="Note"}}

In the 3.(schwere)/Schnelle-Abteilung 376{{refn|According to Scherzer in the 3./Schnelle-Abteilung 376.|group="Note"}}

Observer and aircraft commander in the 3./Kampfgeschwader 4 "General Wever"{{refn|According to Scherzer as pilot and observer in the I./[[Kampfgeschwader 4]] "General Wever".|group="Note"}}
{{sortname|Eberhard|Maisel}}{{refn|According to Scherzer name is spelled [[Eberhard Meisel]].|group="Note"}}
Leader of the I./Waffen-Grenadier-Regiment 45 of the SS (estn. Nr. 1){{refn|According to Scherzer as leader of the I./Waffen-Grenadier-Regiment of the SS 45 (estn. Nr. 1).|group="Note"}}

see von Lewinski called von Manstein
Leader of Kampfgruppe "Marcks" Panzer Armee Afrika{{refn|According to Scherzer as commander of Schützen-Regiment 104 and leader of a [[Kampfgruppe]] in [[Panzer Armee Afrika]].|group="Note"}}

Zugführer (platoon leader) in the 2./SS-Kavallerie-Regiment 15 "Florian Geyer"{{refn|According to Scherzer as ''[[Zugführer (military)|Zugführer]]'' (platoon leader) in the 2./SS-Kavallerie-Regiment 15.|group="Note"}}
13-HOberleutnant{{refn|According to Scherzer as ''[[Oberleutnant]]'' of the [[Military reserve force|Reserves]].|group="Note"}}
Battery leader in the Fallschirm-Flak-Abteilung 5{{refn|According to Scherzer as battery leader in the 5./Fallschirm-Flak-Abteilung 5.|group="Note"}}

Leader of SS-Panzer-Aufklärungs-Abteilung 3 "Totenkopf"{{refn|According to Scherzer as leader Aufklärungs-Abteilung of the [[3rd SS Division Totenkopf|"Totenkopf"-Division]].|group="Note"}}
{{sortname|Dipl.-Ing. Dietrich Freiherr von|Massenbach|Dietrich Freiherr von Massenbach}}
Company chief in the Fähnrichs-Regiment 3 of Division "Märkisch Friedland"{{refn|According to Scherzer as chief of the 2./Fähnrichs-Infanterie-Regiment 3.|group="Note"}}

{{sortname|Siegmund|Matheja}}?{{refn|No evidence of the award can be found in the [[German Federal Archives]]. Von Seemen listed [[Siegmund Matheja]] in his second edition and noted: "No evidence in the German Federal Archives, see history of [[Panzer-Grenadier-Division Großdeutschland|"Großdeutschland" division]]". The history describes the battles at [[Bisamberg]] near [[Korneuburg]] mid April 1945 briefly. Here Matheja presumably destroyed six enemy tanks, Matheja and his actions however are not described in the division's history. The order commission of the [[Association of Knight's Cross Recipients]] (AKCR) processed this case in 1981 and decided "Knight's Cross yes, 6 May 1945". The presentation date is an assumption of the AKCR. Unfortunately Matheja, a member of the AKCR, himself did nothing to help clarify the situation. Twice he failed to respond to a letter (24 July and 22 August 2004) from the chairman of the AKCR.|group="Note"}}
Gruppenkommandeur of the II./Jagdgeschwader 2 "Richthofen"{{refn|According to Scherzer as ''[[Gruppenkommandeur]]'' of the I./[[Jagdgeschwader 2]] "Richthofen".|group="Note"}}

Leader of a Kampfgruppe in the fortress Abschnittskommando "Bärenfänger" in Berlin{{refn|According to Scherzer as leader of a [[Kampfgruppe]] in ''Verteidigungs-Abschnitt'' "A" (defensive sector "A").|group="Note"}}
Leader of the 7./SS-Panzer-Regiment 3 "Totenkopf"{{refn|According to Scherzer as leader of the 7./SS-Panzer-Regiment 3.|group="Note"}}

{{sortname|Walter|Mattusch}}?{{refn|No evidence of the award can be found in the [[German Federal Archives]]. The award was unlawfully presented by SS-''[[Oberstgruppenführer]]'' [[Sepp Dietrich]]. The date is taken from the announcement made by the [[6th Panzer Army|6. SS-Panzerarmee]].|group="Note"}}
{{sortname|Theodor Freiherr von|Mauchenheim|Theodor von Mauchenheim}} called Bechtolsheim

Zugführer (platoon leader) in the 10./leichte Flak-Regiment 411 (self-motorized){{refn|According to Scherzer as ''[[Zugführer (military)|Zugführer]]'' (platoon leader) in the 10./leichte Flak-Abteilung 411 (self-motorized).|group="Note"}}
File:Bundesarchiv Bild 183-2006-0822-500, Gotenhafen, Generalleutnant Karl Mauss.jpg

Zugführer (platoon leader) in the 3./Heeres-Pionier-Bataillon 671 (motorized){{refn|According to Scherzer as ''[[Zugführer (military)|Zugführer]]'' (platoon leader) in the 3./Heeres-Pionier-Bataillon 671.|group="Note"}}
Commander of Grenadier-Regiment 554{{refn|According to Scherzer as commander of Grenadier-Regiment 545.|group="Note"}}
12-LLeutnant of the Reserves{{refn|According to Scherzer as ''[[Leutnant]]'' and pilot in the III./[[Jagdgeschwader 2]] "Richthofen".|group="Note"|name="Egon Mayer"}}

{{sortname|Helmuth|Mayer zur Linde}}{{refn|According to Scherzer his name is Helmuth Mayer who received the Knight's Cross of the Iron Cross as commander of III./Grenadier-Regiment 102.|group="Note"|name="Helmuth Mayer"}}
Staffelkapitän in the I./Jagdgeschwader 3{{refn|According to Scherzer as ''[[Staffelkapitän]]'' of the 2./[[Jagdgeschwader 3]].|group="Note"}}
Leader of a Kampfgruppe in Jäger-Regiment 28
Leader of a Kampfstaffel of the commander-in-chief of the Heeresgruppe Afrika
Befehlshaber der deutsches Marinekommandos in Italien (Commander-in-chief of the German Naval Commando in Italy)
In the Pak-Artillerie-Abteilung 1037{{refn|According to Scherzer as commander of Artillerie-Pak-Abteilung (''bodenständig''—rooted in the soil) 1037.|group="Note"}}
Chief of the general staff of the 3. Gebirgs-Division{{refn|According to Scherzer as chief of the general staff of the XXIX. Armeekorps.|group="Note"}}
Regiment adjutant in Grenadier-Regiment 380{{refn|According to Scherzer as adjutant in Grenadier-Regiment 380.|group="Note"}}
12-HLeutnant{{refn|According to Scherzer as ''[[Leutnant]]'' of the [[Military reserve force|Reserves]] and leader in the Panzer-Jäger-Abteilung 26.|group="Note"|name="Meier"}}

Awarded (874th) Oak Leaves 9 May 1945?{{refn|[[Hans Meier]]'s nomination for the Oak Leaves was received by the ''[[Heerespersonalamt]]'' (HPA—Army Staff Office) from the troop on 12 April 1945 and approved by all intermittent commanding officers. No further comments or indications of approval have been noted and left unfinished by the end of the war. A non contemporary file card notes an entry date 17 March 1945 which could be the nomination date of the troop. The nomination list for the higher grades of Knight's Cross of the Iron Cross indicates an entry date 12 April 1945, no further date is listed. A comment states: "Unfinished". According to the [[Association of Knight's Cross Recipients]] (AKCR) the award was presented in accordance with the [[Dönitz-decree]]. This is illegal according to the [[Deutsche Dienststelle (WASt)]] and lacks legal justification. The sequential number "874" was assigned by the AKCR, the presentation date by Fellgiebel.|group="Note"}}
Pilot in the 9./Schlachtgeschwader 77{{refn|According to Scherzer as pilot in the Stab III./[[Schlachtgeschwader 77]].|group="Note"}}
Chief of the 14.(Panzerjäger)/Infanterie-Regiment 79{{refn|According to Scherzer as chief of the 14./Infanterie-Regiment 79.|group="Note"}}
Staffelführer in the 1./Jagdgeschwader 26 "Schlageter"{{refn|According to Scherzer as ''[[Staffelkapitän|Staffelführer]]'' in the I./[[Jagdgeschwader 52]].|group="Note"}}
Leader of SS-Sturmgeschütz-Batterie "Totenkopf"{{refn|According to Scherzer as leader of Sturmgeschütz-Batterie [[3rd SS Division Totenkopf|SS-Division-"Totenkopf"]].|group="Note"}}
Commander of Fallschirmjäger-Sturm-Regiment{{refn|According to Scherzer as commander of Luftlande-Sturm-Regiment 1.|group="Note"}}

Awarded 564th Oak Leaves 31 August 1944
{{fontcolor||#ffdead;|(155th) Swords 8 May 1945?{{refn|[[Eugen Meindl]]'s nomination by the troop was approved by each of his commanding officers. However the nomination contains no final remark on the proceedings. ''Oberst'' [[Nicolaus von Below]], Hitler's ''Luftwaffe'' adjutant, had sent a teleprinter message to the commanding general of the Fallschirmarmee ''[[Generaloberst]]'' [[Kurt Student]], requesting a statement for this nomination. The copy of the teleprinter message contains a note: resubmission "23 April 1945". It seems that the statement was never returned. The paperwork was not finalized by the end of the war. The [[Association of Knight's Cross Recipients]] (AKCR) claims that the award was presented in accordance with the [[Dönitz-decree]]. This is illegal according to the [[Deutsche Dienststelle (WASt)]] and lacks legal justification. The sequential number "155" was assigned by the AKCR. Fellgiebel assigned the presentation date. Meindl is mentioned on a list of the ''Oberbefehlshaber Nordwest'' for "Nominations and Bestowal of War Awards" from May 1945. This list, which was intended to be presented to [[Karl Dönitz]], contained twelve names of pending nominations which had been submitted via the chain of command. Dönitz has never signed this list, most likely he has never even seen this list. The responsible personnel offices awarded or declined eight nominations from this list by the end of the war by, two remained unprocessed by the ''[[Heerespersonalamt]]'' (HPA—Army Staff Office) and ''Luftwaffenpersonalamt'' (LPA—Luftwaffe Staff Office) and two further were left ready for signing at the ''Oberkommando der Wehrmacht/Wehrmacht-Führungsstab'' (OKW/WFSt—''Oberkommando der Wehrmacht/Wehrmacht-Führungsstab''—leadership staff of the Army High Command).|group="Note"}}}}
15-HMajor{{refn|According to Scherzer as ''[[Major (Germany)|Major]]'' of the [[Military reserve force|Reserves]].|group="Note"}}
Deputy group leader in the Pionierzug/Grenadier-Regiment 528

Commander of heavy cruiser Admiral Hipper

Deputy leader of Sturmgruppe "Eisen" (Assault Group "Iron") in Fallschirmjäger-Sturm-Abteilung "Koch"{{refn|According to Scherzer as leader of ''Sturmgruppe'' "Eisen" (Assault Group "Iron") in [[Luftlande-Sturm-Regiment|Luftlande-Sturm-Abteilung "Koch"]].|group="Note"}}

Chief of the general staff of the III. Panzerkorps

{{sortname|Hans-Joachim|Merks}}?{{refn|There is no reference of the Knight's Cross awarded to [[Hans-Joachim Merks]] in the [[German Federal Archives]]. His personal file contains a letter from 1955 by the [[Deutsche Dienststelle (WASt)]], indicating that no proof of the award exists. The date was assigned by the [[Association of Knight's Cross Recipients]] (AKCR).|group="Note"}}
Panzer driver in the 1./Panzer-Jäger-Abteilung 72{{#rag:ref|According to Scherzer as ''[[Sturmgeschütz]]'' (assault gun) driver in the 1./Panzer-Jäger-Abteilung 72.|group="Note"}}
Zugführer (platoon leader) in Flak-Regiment 36 (motorized){{refn|According to Scherzer as ''[[Zugführer (military)|Zugführer]]'' (platoon leader) in the 10./Flak-Regiment 36.|group="Note"}}
Pilot and technical officer in the Stab I./Kampfgeschwader 4 "General Wever"
Oberschirrmeister (a trained vehicle mechanic) in the 3./Panzer-Jäger-Abteilung 13
Staffelkapitän of the 5.(S)/Lehrgeschwader 2{{refn|According to Scherzer as ''[[Staffelkapitän]]'' of the 10.(S)/[[Lehrgeschwader 2]].|group="Note"}}
16-HOberstleutnant{{refn|According to Scherzer as ''[[Oberstleutnant]] zur Verwendung'' (for disposition).|group="Note"}}
Transport glider pilot in the 12./Luftlandegeschwader 1{{refn|According to Scherzer as pilot of a transport glider in the III./Luftlandegeschwader 1.|group="Note"}}

{{sortname|Friedrich-August|Meyer}}?{{refn|[[Friedrich-August Meyer]]{{'}}s ''Luftwaffenpersonalamt-Verleihungsvorschlag'' (LPA-VV—Air Force Staff Office Nomination Recommendation) Nr. 1493 was forwarded to the adjutancy of [[Hermann Göring]] on 3 March 1945. The nomination was never finalized and was left unfinished by the end of the war. A radio message was sent by the chief of the LPA on 12 May 1945 stating that Meyer, effective as of today, has been awarded the Knight's Cross and therefore an unlawful presentation. The presentation date 9 May 1945 was assigned by [[Walther-Peer Fellgiebel]].|group="Note"}}
Commander of Fallschirm-Panzer-Ersatz and Ausbildungs-Brigade "Hermann Göring"

Leader of the I./SS-Freiwilligen-Panzergrenadier-Regiment 49 "De Ruyter"{{refn|According to Scherzer as leader of the I./SS-Freiwilligen-Panzergrenadier-Regiment 49 "De Ruyter" (niederl. Nr. 2).|group="Note"}}

Staatssekretär der Luftfahrt im Reichsluftfahrtministerium (State Secretary of aviation in the Ministry of Aviation){{refn|According to Scherzer as chief of [[Luftflotte 5]] and ''Befehlshaber Nord'' (commander-in-chief north).|group="Note"}}

{{sortname|Berndt Lubich von|Milovan}}{{refn|According to Scherzer name is Berndtlubich von Milovan, listing him under the letter "L", who aacording to Scherzer received the Knight's Cross as eader of the 1./SS-Sturmgeschütz-Abteilung 3.|group="Note"|name="Milovan"}}

Transferred to the 19. Panzer-Division for general staff training and leader of Panzer-Aufklärungs-Abteilung 19{{refn|According to Scherzer as leader of Panzer-Aufklärungs-Abteilung 19.|group="Note"}}
Commander of the III./Panzergrenadier-Regiment 2{{refn|According to Scherzer as II./Panzergrenadier-Regiment 2.|group="Note"}}

Awarded (873rd) Oak Leaves 9 May 1945?{{refn|The nomination was received by the ''[[Heerespersonalamt]]'' (HPA—Army Staff Office) from the troop on 28 April 1945 and approved by the Corps and by the [[OB West]]. Missing is a statement by the Army and by the Army Group (''Heeresruppe''). ''Major'' [[Joachim Domaschk]] decided "Oak Leaves yes" but deferred, [[Army Group B|Heeresgruppe B]]—the Sturmgeschütz-Brigade had already surrendered together with the Heeresgruppe B in the [[Ruhr Pocket]]. The nomination was therefore left unfinished according to ''AHA 44 Ziff. 572''. The nomination list of the higher grade of the Knight's Cross of the Iron Cross with Oak Leaves confirms the entry of 28 March 1945. Noted here is a comment indicating "deferred". A formal presentation has not happened. The sequential number "868" was assigned by the [[Association of Knight's Cross Recipients]] (AKCR). The presentation date was assigned by Fellgiebel. [[Alfred Montag]] was a member of the AKCR.|group="Note"}}
Gun leader in the 14./SS-Freiwilligen-Legion "Nederland"{{refn|According to Scherzer as gun leader in the 14./SS-Freiwilligen-Legion "Niederlande".|group="Note"}}
{{sortname|Willi|Morawietz}}{{refn|According to Scherzer name is spelled [[Wilhelm Morawietz]].|group="Note"}}
Gruppenkommandeur of the IV./Jagdgeschwader 3 "Udet"{{refn|According to Scherzer as ''[[Gruppenkommandeur]]'' of the IV.(Sturm)/[[Jagdgeschwader 3]] "Udet".|group="Note"}}

{{sortname|Max|Morsche}}?{{refn|According to Scherzer his name is [[Max Morche]]. Morche had been nominated for the Knight's Cross of the Iron Cross on 31 January 1945 via [[teleprinter]] message by the [[XX Army Corps (Wehrmacht)|XX Army Corps]]. This teleprinter message is no longer available. The ''[[Heerespersonalamt]] Abteilung P 5/Registratur'' (Army Personnel Office Department P 5/Registry) received a teleprinter message on 8 February 1945 from the commander-in-chief of the [[Army Group North]], which made reference to the former message. This second message contained the approvals of Morche's intermittent commanders, ''[[General of the Infantry (Germany)|General der Infanterie]]'' [[Friedrich-Wilhelm Müller]] ([[4th Army (Wehrmacht)|4th Army]]) and ''[[Generaloberst]]'' [[Lothar Rendulic]] (Army Group North). Nevertheless the nomionation must have been rejected because Morche was not listed in the nomination book. Also missing are the nominations by the troop and the ''Heerespersonalamt-Verleihungsvorschlag'' (HPA-VV—Army Staff Office Nomination Recommendation), nor is there a file card. The Order Commission of the [[Association of Knight's Cross Recipients]] (AKCR) never processed Morche's case. According to the AKCR the award was presented in accordance with the [[Dönitz-decree]]. This is illegal according to the [[Deutsche Dienststelle (WASt)]] and lacks legal justification.|group="Note"}}

Geschwaderkommodore of Kampfgeschwader z.b.V. 1 and Lufttransportführer Ost (Air Transportation Leader East) of Luftflotte 1{{refn|According to Scherzer as Lufttransportführer (Air Transportation Leader) with the quarter master general of the Luftwaffe.|group="Note"}}

Zugführer (platoon leader) in the 2./Panzer-Abteilung 106 "Feldherrnhalle"{{refn|According to Scherzer as ''[[Zugführer (military)|Zugführer]]'' (platoon leader) in the 2./Panzer-Abteilung 2106.|group="Note"}}
Pilot in the 2./Schlachtgeschwader 2 "Immelmann"{{refn|According to Scherzer as pilot in the I./[[Schlachtgeschwader 2]] "Immelmann".|group="Note"}}
{{sortname|Ewald|Mrousek}}{{refn|According to Scherzer name is spelled Ewald Mrusek.|group="Note"}}

{{sortname|Walter|Müller|Walter Müller (pilot)|Mueller, Walter}}!{{refn|The addendum of [[Walther-Peer Fellgiebel]]{{'}}s book, ''Die Träger des Ritterkreuzes des Eisernen Kreuzes 1939–1945'' (in German), contains a note indicating that [[Walter Müller (pilot)|Walter Müller]] needs to be struck from the list.|group="Note"}}
Deputy commander of the I./Flak-Regiment 231 (motorized){{refn|According to Scherzer as leader of the I./Flak-Regiment 231 (motorized).|group="Note"}}

{{sortname|Friedrich|Müller-Rochholz||Mueller-Rochholz, Friedrich}}?{{refn|No evidence of the award can be found in the [[German Federal Archives]]. The files of the order commission of the [[Association of Knight's Cross Recipients]] (AKCR) indicated that [[Friedrich Müller-Rochholz]]{{'}}s former divisional commander ''[[Generalmajor]]'' [[Hermann Schulte-Heuthaus]] in 1961 recalled that he had nominated five members of his division, presumably among them Müller-Rochholz, for the Knight's Cross of the Iron Cross in the timeframe mid to end-March 1945. Additionally a further intermittent commander, the former commanding general of the [[Panzer Corps Grossdeutschland|Panzer-Korps "Großdeutschland"]] ''[[General der Panzertruppe]]'' [[Georg Jauer]], stated in 1961 that he had as a matter of principle always approved awards for distinguished officers. The nomination however has either never made it to the ''[[Heerespersonalamt]]'' (HPA—Army Staff Office), a fact already noted by Von Seemen, or had been rejected by the HPA. The HPA never created an internal approval request. Müller-Rochholz is also not listed in the book "''Verliehene Ritterkreuze''" (Awarded Knight Crosses). An autonomous presentation can also be ruled out because Müller-Rochholz had been nominated via the command chain. The presentation date was assigned by [[Walther-Peer Fellgiebel]]. Müller-Rochholz was a member of the AKCR.|group="Note"}}
Staffelkapitän of the 7./Jagdgeschwader 26 "Schlageter"{{refn|According to Scherzer as adjutant in the III./[[Jagdgeschwader 26]] "Schlageter".|group="Note"}}
Regiment adjutant in Panzergrenadier-Regiment 111{{refn|According to Scherzer as adjutant in Panzergrenadier-Regiment 111.|group="Note"}}

13-LOberleutnant of the Reserves{{refn|According to Scherzer as ''[[Oberleutnant]]'' (war officer) and observer in the Aufklärungsstaffel 1.(F)/[[Aufklärungsgruppe 121|121]].|group="Note"|name="Muggenthaler"}}

Leader of the anti-aircraft armoured train in the 5./Flak-Abteilung 505{{refn|According to Scherzer as leader of the 5./gemischte Flak-Abteilung 505 (deployable) and leader of an anti-aircraft armoured train (makeshift) of the 9. Flak-Division.|group="Note"}}
Leader of Panzer-Jäger-Abteilung 111{{refn|According to Scherzer as leader of Panzer-Jäger-Abteilung 111 and of a [[Kampfgruppe]].|group="Note"}}
